## Functions

### LLVMParseIRInContext() {#ga319e4562ffb47ec6eba2eb70ffdbaa37}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMBool LLVMParseIRInContext (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga9c43e01525516ff6b4feab5166c5b1da">LLVMContextRef</a> ContextRef, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga9867eaa7b17ba17405cdf2539bedb108">LLVMMemoryBufferRef</a> MemBuf, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gad1d1bb5f901c903a0cf09c5a053c9c56">LLVMModuleRef</a> &#42; OutM, char &#42;&#42; OutMessage)</>}>
Read LLVM IR from a memory buffer and convert it into an in-memory Module object.

Returns 0 on success. Optionally returns a human-readable description of any errors that occurred during parsing IR. OutMessage must be disposed with LLVMDisposeMessage.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
llvm::ParseIR()
</SectionUser>
